oai_dc:dc.dc:title: West End Church of Christ, 2002 January
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of West End Church of Christ located at 3532 West End Avenue in Nashville, Tennessee. The congregation formed in 1943 while the church was constructed in 1948. The architect was Donald Southgate, a prominent Nashville church designer of the time. The foundation is stone. The exterior walls are red brick with decorative stone elements. The roof is made of asphalt shingles and has a gabled roof line. The windows are arched, circular and rectangular with stained glass panes. Doors are made of green painted wood with white door frames and brass fixtures. Special features include a ninety-six foot steeple with lantern oval windows, belfry pediments and columns. Other features include pediments, columns and a portico on the main building. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: West End Church of Christ (Nashville, Tenn.)
